alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Dubois; Martin; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 7:36PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers and creek, and locations, in Indiana... Big Blue River at Carthage. East Fork White River from Columbus down to Shoals. Buck Creek at Acton. Flatrock River near Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river and location in Indiana... Big Blue River at Shelbyville. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Shoals. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Significant flooding of agricultural lands begins. Livestock in low bottoms must be moved to higher ground. Cemetery Road, East River Road, and SR 550 near Hindostan Church, and SR 257 south of Washington begins to flood. Water on Dubois CR 725 North in March 2011. Water receded from SR 550 during March 2011 on the south side of the river in the Loogootee area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - No recently observed stage height is available. - Forecast...The river will be quasi-stationary around 17 to 18 feet tonight, then rise through Tuesday, reaching flood stage of 20 feet Tuesday night. The river is expect to crest at 21 feet Thursday. The river will fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
